The_Sky_Kings:
{{Infobox musical artist | | name = The Sky Kings | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | alias = Four Wheel Drive | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], United States | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 1991–1997 | label = [[RCA Records|RCA Nashville]]

[[Foster & Lloyd|Bill Lloyd]]

[[Rusty Young (musician)|Rusty Young]] }} '''The Sky Kings''' was an American country music [[supergroup (music)|supergroup]][http://baltimoresongwriters.org/pages/interviews/bill_lloyd_interview.html Music Interview with Bill Lloyd] formed in 1991 as '''Four Wheel Drive'''.[http://www.billlloydmusic.com/skykings.html Bill Lloyd Music] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.today/20070812020821/http://www.billlloydmusic.com/skykings.html |date=2007-08-12 }} The band consisted of [[John Cowan]], [[Foster & Lloyd|Bill Lloyd]], [[Patrick Simmons]] and [[Rusty Young (musician)|Rusty Young]]. They were signed to a recording deal with [[RCA Records|RCA Nashville]] and completed an album which for the label was never released. [[Warner Bros. Records]] signed the group in 1993. Threatened with lawsuits from bands who had copyrighted the name Four Wheel Drive, they secured the rights to the name The Sky Kings. After opening for [[The Doobie Brothers]] on their 1993 tour, Simmons left The Sky Kings to rejoin The Doobie Brothers. Now a trio, The Sky Kings released three singles on Warner Bros.: "Picture Perfect," "Fooled Around and Fell in Love" (a cover of the [[Elvin Bishop]] hit) and "That Just About Says It All."[{{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p424853/biography|pure_url=yes}} allmusic ((( The Sky Kings > Overview )))] "Picture Perfect" was the only single to chart, peaking at No. 52 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart.[{{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p424853/charts-awards|pure_url=yes}} allmusic ((( The Sky Kings > Charts & Awards > Billboard Singles )))] An eponymous album was scheduled to be released in 1997, but eventually shelved.[{{AllMusic|class=album|id=r494033|pure_url=yes}} allmusic ((( From Out of the Blue > Overview )))] [[Rhino Handmade]] released ''From Out of the Blue'', an album which collected the entire unreleased 1997 Warner Bros. album, non-album Warner Bros. singles, and recordings and demos made for a second unreleased Warner Bros. album, in 2000. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:14em;"| Title ! style="width:16em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''From Out of the Blue'' | * Released: July 26, 2000 * Label: Rhino Handmade |- ! scope="row"| ''1992'' | * Released: December 15, 2014 * Label: [[Sony Music Entertainment]] |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
